results.title: On the trail of the torturers
results.creator_credit: Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
As Greece prepares for its first democratic election in a decade, “World in Action” focuses on the torturers who were recruited by the former dictatorship to “discourage” opposition. This is a powerful and confronting documentary containing graphic accounts by both the torturers and the victims of torture.

results.title: On the thread of a tale
results.creator_credit: Animation Film Studio and Constantin Mustetea
results.brief_description: Animated fairy tale with characters created out of a gradually unwinding ball of yarn. Depicts the adventures of Prince Charming and his fabulous horse, in search of his ladylove who has been captured by an ogre.

results.title: On the side of the angels
results.creator_credit: Peter Kaufmann, Claire Jager and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: This film presents the story of the people involved in the movement for peace in Australia from 1900 to the present. Using rare archival film, the program reflects on the international events that concerned and influenced many people to organise together for peace and world stability. Features Ralph Gibson, founding member against war and fascism in the 30s, Stephen Murray-Smith, peace historian, Sam Goldbloom, Council for International Cooperation and Disarmament, Jim Cairns, Deputy Prime Minister with the Whitlam government, Jean McLean, radical Victorian Labour MP and Jo Camilleri, Convenor of People for Nuclear Disarmament.

results.title: On the road with Circus Oz
results.creator_credit: Ukiyo Films, Don McLennan and Zbigniew Friedrich
results.brief_description: Follows the members of Circus Oz on a six week country tour. Performances and rehearsals are juxtaposed with interviews and scenes of the back-breaking effort that goes into keeping the show on the road. Reveals the performers as being dedicated to their skills, and commited to a philosophy which precludes any hierarchical structure or discrimination on the grounds of sex or ability. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: On the outer
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Russell Toose
results.brief_description: Investigates the plight of two of Sydney’s homeless men - one a widower in his sixties, the other a young man in his twenties - against a background of their fellow homeless people and the hostels where they live. Reporter: Richard Oxenburgh. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit: Lyn Norfor, Jane Oehr and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A trilogy about three teenagers seeking their independence in the outside world after finishing school. The three stories show the problems faced by a generation leaving school in the mid 1980s - boredom with school (“Exit Eddie Leech”), sexual pressures in the workplace (“Ring of Confidence”), and keeping a job (“Beginner’s luck”).
results.title_for_label: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn Norfor, Jane Oehr and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
